Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: SHORT-TERM INVESTMENTS INCLUDE ASSETS TO PROVIDE SUFFICIENT LIQUIDITY TO MEET THE CASH FLOW REQUIREMENTS OF THE CORPORATION. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE LONG-TERM INVESTMENTS IS FOR THE GROWTH OF PRINCIPAL. ANY DISTRIBUTION OR WITHDRAWAL WILL BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH POLICIES ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE CORPORATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND A BOARD MEMBER HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP THAT PROVIDES TRAINING TO OTHER COMPANIES AND INDIVIDUALS

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A Preliminary copy of the 990 is reviewed with the Board of Directors at a monthly board meeting for their inspection, comments, and questions. Changes can then be made, if deemed appropriate, to the 990 tax return.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The policy is distributed, annually, with instructions indicating what the employee must do to disclose the conflict of interest.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Human Resource Committee of the Board of Directors conducts an annual evaluation of the Executive Director. The evaluation consists of organizational goals and objectives, which become the Executive director's goals for his performance evaluation. The annual report is collated, reviewed, and accepted by the full Board of Directors. The Human Resource Committee meets with the Executive Director, who conducts a self-evaluation, and is also evaluated on five categories. The Committee meets independently of the Executive Director and determines compensation based upon the evaluation and review of local, regional, and national Executive Director's compensation and reports with recommendations to the full Board of Directors. This process was last undertaken in 2010. For the Associate Executive Director, Perseus House researches local, regional, and national salaries for the Associate Executive Director. His salary is then determined based upon this information, and approved by the full board of Directors during the annual process of the annual budget presentation and approval.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All documents are on file at the central office of Perseus House, Inc. Copies may be requested and are available for review, by the public, personally. Financial Statements are contractually required to be submitted to all governmental agencies.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: PERSEUS HOUSE CHARTER SCHOOL OF EXCELLENCE

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: An extension to file form 990 was filed with and approved by the IRS
